name: whin
description: Send and receive any message type to your WhatsApp, or to whatsapp groups with a shared gateway.

api_methods.name: send to groups
api_methods.description: This endpoint will send a message to a whatsapp group. You need the group-id to route the message. Check this [video](https://youtu.be/wD0DWoua0L4) lo learn how to use it.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: Enter the group identification (gid) provided by whin when you requested a group. Check the [video](https://youtu.be/wD0DWoua0L4) to learn how to get it.

utterances.utterance: Send a message to the family chat group.
Can you post an update in the project team group?
Share the event details with the book club group.
Please send the meeting agenda to the marketing team group.
Notify the soccer team group about the match schedule.
Send a reminder to the study group about tomorrow's session.
Can you send the latest news to the neighborhood watch group?
Share the photos with the travel buddies group.
Send the birthday wishes to the friends group.
Please post the dinner invitation in the gourmet club group.

api_methods.name: send
api_methods.description: It will send  you a whatsapp. Learn how to use this endpoint: a text on this [video](https://youtu.be/MqAbY6Gu8yM), or this one for [media](https://youtu.be/qq3prJTVMRg) file types.

utterances.utterance: Send me a WhatsApp message.
Can you send a WhatsApp to my group?
I need to receive a WhatsApp message.
Please send a WhatsApp message to my contact list.
Forward a WhatsApp message to my family group.
Could you send a WhatsApp text to my friend?
I want to receive a WhatsApp notification.
Dispatch a WhatsApp message to my colleagues.
Can you send a WhatsApp to my business group?
Please send a WhatsApp message to my team.

api_methods.name: personal listener
api_methods.description:
The response is an url that you have to use as a webhook destination at the origin service. The content sent to it will be routed as a message to a whatsapp group owned by the user, or to the user.
Learn use-cases on these videos: [grafana alerts](https://youtu.be/RvVgg0qwNDk),[Shelly notifications](https://youtu.be/B6MLlBUkyvo), [synology notifications](https://youtu.be/zeAJNuXYqH4).

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: Each whatsapp group will have its own webhook address; set the group-id on this field to get a unique valid url and deliver webhooks as messages on each whatsapp group. Learn how to get a valid value [here](https://rapidapi.com/inutil-inutil-default/api/whin2/tutorials/how-to-use-the-groups-category-to-send-and-receive-whatsapps-to%2Ffrom-groups%3F-1).

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: This is the service that is sending Webhooks to your whin personal receiver. If the origin service is nos listed you can select `Do not include in request`, or leave the value blank, and whin will do its best to parse the payload received.

api_methods.name: create a group
api_methods.description: This API will create a group, it will add you, and will promote you to Admin of the group. Check this [video](https://youtu.be/wD0DWoua0L4) to learn how to use it.

utterances.utterance: Can you set up a new WhatsApp group for me?

I'd like to establish a WhatsApp group with me as the admin.
Could you create a WhatsApp group and make me the administrator?

api_methods.name: group invite link
api_methods.description: the endpoint returns an invite link url for a group you own.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: the group id of which you want to get an invite link url

api_methods.name: list groups
api_methods.description: This endpoint returns a list of the groups you created through whin.

api_methods.description: this endpoint shall be used by the origin services, it's **NOT** to be used on the playground.

api_methods.description: This endpoint shall be triggered by the webhook origin and is not intended to be used through this frontend.

api_methods.name: set url
api_methods.description: Set a whin-receive endpoint. Learn how to use it on this [video](https://youtu.be/8WyG_becZXM). This is the valid url where the whatsapps you send to whin, or are written on a whatsapp group, will be delivered. The url has to be accessible from the internet; this endpoint expects a 200 response from the destination, otherwise it wont be set.

utterances.utterance: Can you configure the endpoint for receiving WhatsApp messages?
I need to set up a URL for my WhatsApp message delivery.
Please establish a valid endpoint for my WhatsApp group messages.

Set up the endpoint for delivering WhatsApp messages to my server.
Can you help me establish a URL for my WhatsApp message endpoint?
I need assistance in setting the endpoint for my WhatsApp group messages.
Please configure the URL for receiving messages from my WhatsApp account.

api_methods.name: show url
api_methods.description:
This endpoint is used to request the webhook routes created on your account. 
Learn how to use it on this [video](https://youtu.be/8WyG_becZXM)

utterances.utterance: Can you show me the webhook routes I've set up for my account?

api_methods.name: websocket checker
api_methods.description:
Whin-receive (thick-client) websockets checker. 
This endpoint is **ONLY** used to authorize websocket connections to the backend by thick clients. The Response is a token needed to complete handshaking.

utterances.utterance: Can you verify the websocket connection for my WhatsApp client?
I need to authorize a websocket connection for my messaging app.
Please check if the websocket connection is authorized for my WhatsApp.
Is the websocket connection for my thick client authorized?
Can you confirm the websocket authorization for my WhatsApp gateway?
I want to ensure the websocket connection is properly authorized.
Could you verify the websocket authorization for my WhatsApp integration?
Check if my thick client is authorized to connect via websocket.
Is my websocket connection authorized for the backend?
Please confirm the websocket authorization status for my WhatsApp client.

api_methods.name: signup
api_methods.description: This endpoint is **ONLY** used to enter the code you received to signup. Follow this [video](https://youtu.be/uOZ-oH4kP58), or read the [tutorial](https://rapidapi.com/inutil-inutil-default/api/whin2/tutorials/what-to-do-to-start-using-whin%3F-1), to learn how to start using whin.
